docs.snippet: The anticipation is building for the last leg of the fashion show marathon....
docs.lead_paragraph: Paris Fashion Week is less than 24 hours away, and although there is still Oscar buzz about Natalie's win in Rodarte and Cate's incredible Givenchy couture, the anticipation is building for the last leg of the fashion show marathon. Kickoff begins tomorrow with Hakaan's second Paris show. Daria and Natalia walked the runway there last year, so expect the casting to set the bar high.
docs.abstract: The anticipation is building for the last leg of the fashion show marathon.

headline.main: Amuse-Bouche | Stoking the Appetite for Paris Fashion Week

docs.snippet: Charles H. Ferguson - the director of the Academy Award-winning documentary "Inside Job" who used his acceptance speech to decry the lack of justice in the aftermath of the financial crisis - expands on the regulatory shortcomings in an interview ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Charles H. Ferguson, director of the Academy Award-winning documentary "Inside Job", used his Oscars acceptance speech to decry the lack of justice in the aftermath of the financial crisis. In an interview with DealBook editor Andrew Ross Sorkin before Sunday's ceremony, Mr. Ferguson expands on the regulatory shortcomings.

headline.main: Oscar Spotlight Puts Wall Street Under Harsh Light

docs.snippet: In difficult year for the Oscar telecast on ABC, early ratings from 56 markets were down only a smidge from last year....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Oscars appear to have dodged a bullet. In a difficult year for the ABC telecast - two youthful and untested hosts and a group of top races with heavy favorites - early ratings from 56 markets were down only a smidge from last year. Among adults 18 to 49 in these markets, the 83rd Academy Awards posted a 14.5 rating, down from 14.8 last year, according to Nielsen. ABC won't have national ratings, which will include information about millions of viewers, until about 3 p.m. Eastern time on Monday.
docs.abstract: In difficult year for the Oscar telecast on ABC, early ratings from 56 markets were down only a smidge from last year.

headline.main: Early Oscar Ratings Suggest Slightly Fewer Viewers Than Last Year

docs.snippet: The Vanity Fair post-Oscars bash is a glittery, hair-down celebration, fed by flutes of champagne and comfort food....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES - The Governors Ball may have been sleepy, but the other must-stop Oscars afterparty, thrown by Vanity Fair at the Sunset Towers, had wind-up energy. At its height it felt like a starry sea where everyone from Hollywood and the worlds it touches - which is all of them - bobbed in to do a lap.
docs.abstract: The Vanity Fair post-Oscars bash is a glittery, hair-down celebration, fed by flutes of champagne and comfort food.

headline.main: A Celebrity Force Field at the Vanity Fair Party

docs.snippet: At a subdued Governors Ball, chatter focused on the failure of Tom Hooper, the director of "The King's Speech," to thank Harvey Weinstein....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES - Was it the lack of suspense at the Oscar ceremonies or just plain awards-season exhaustion that hung over the Governors Ball Sunday night? Perhaps a ho-humness that a British entry won best picture? Maybe the dark blue lighting was responsible for the low-key vibe. It was palpable, whatever it was.
docs.abstract: At a subdued Governors Ball, chatter focused on the failure of Tom Hooper, the director of "The King's Speech," to thank Harvey Weinstein.

headline.main: Talk of a Faux Pas at a Weary Governors Ball
